"Come help us Duane,buddy!..,Meet the guys!...The studio is a mess,but you know Jim Gordon there layin' over there,strung out,dontcha? That quiverin' jello mess on the floor there.that's Bobby Whitlock!!!..Carl Radle,late of D&B & Friends?..The "Friends" always bring over the best heroin!!!..Of course,I'm Eric and when I find my own vein,owww,squishhh!!!..we'll be ready to go,so you can help save this album and my ass please,Duane!!!"  (A fly on the wall,back then!)

The guitar interplay between Clapton and Duane Allman takes the spotlight throughout Layla but Carl Radle's bass guitar provides a great bottom as well.

Song *4 (Nobody... ...Out)...this is where Duane hopped on aboard and the rest they say....I wonder if Duane knew he might take part in one of biggest dramas in R & R history down the road and also be indirectly involved just by his great guitarwork on what became the Biggest Soap Opera of it`s Day via L & OALS
